This place has the perfect Carne Asada meat, nice char on it, not tough, juicy, flavorful, quality meat never any gristle or fat, all perfectly trimmed off. I get it Mexican style with just cilantro onion and lime juice mmm all the flavors mingle together so nicely that way. Once I accidentally ordered it with everything which means lettuce tomato and cheese and I was so mad I think all that stuff, especially the cheese, ruins the natural simple amazing flavors of good meat with lime juice, it was still good with everything, not surprising, honestly everything is great here but the simple way I think is best when it comes to steak. Their shakes are huge and satisfying, their gorditas are also out of this world try it with either Asada or al pastor if you want something super rich, they have great servers, it's always clean, I just find no flaws in this place. I would come here for my Mexican food fix at least once a week when my mom was away in Mexico, I think that says a lot. This place is so underappreciated just because it's out of the way for most people but honestly come out here for the best tacos gorditas and Mexican goodies in general.

20.description: My favorite taco place ever!  The pastor, steak, and chile relleno tacos are the best I've ever had and they're SO CHEAP.  The standard red sauce for the tacos is phenomenal. Speaking of dining in, this place can easily seat 60 people, but if you want to place an order, just go to the register in back.  The restaurant is often full of Chicago cops during lunch.  So for those of you who think the neighborhood is unsafe, get over it.  Back to the red sauce. If you dine-in, it gets brought to you in an open dish with a spoon.  The dishes are usually very full, so I'm guessing once you're done, the sauce goes to the next table.  Which makes the germophobe in me want to zip myself in a hazmat suit, but you can always ask for sauce on the side. If you dine in, they do have menus and take your order at your table. You get free tortilla chips, too.Parking is tricky - street parking in front is often full, but you can park around the corner.ANYWAY, BEST TACOS EVER.

19.description: El Charro simply has THE best tacos al pastor I know!  Everyone I know loves this place because of their al pastor tacos. Everything in here is pretty good, but the main atraction for me is the pastor tacos.  The only off and odd beef I have with El Charro is in regards to their "milanesa" torta, which tastes ok, but its a pretty big turn off that its not even a real piece of steak, but rather a finely ground up beef concoction spread thinly to look like a breaded slice of steak. I dont understand whats the need is for that, when it would be easier to bread a nice thin slice of steak. This place is always busy, wether for take out or dine in and open late, and its been open and in business for a while now, so that says a lot.

2.description: I live in the Southeast Side of Chicago and this is a great place to order Mexican food and just a few blocks from my house. I typically order their burritos de carne asada and 99.9% of the time they do a great job. The last time I ordered the burrito it was a little soggy so I decided to order their gorditas de carne asada the following time I went in and let me say this: THEY ARE AWESOME! The gordita is not overly greasy and the gordita is thick and not thin and falling apart as i have experienced in other restaurants. If you are in the neighborhood and want authentic Mexican food stop by and have their gorditas! Also...they have bottled Coke from Mexico (which I love) - another perk! :-) Finally, if you are looking for good cheese fries (although not typical Mexican food) - is also very very very yummy!

18.description: I have yet to find Horchata that I love more than the kind that I find here. Moreover, chips and pico de gallo/salsa/chiles are given with every meal when dining in - a little something I appreciate.Fantastic taste, price, portion, and service.

13.description: I find it weird that only 5-6 people work there but it's a great place to eat ! I love their tacos , gorditas and agua horchata . You're missing out if you don't try it !

4.description: I came to this place with pretty high expectations based on the yelp reviews, and found that they has good food, but was disappointed because it didn't seem great to me. It seemed way too greasy, and I didn't think the horchata was anything special. I was actually very disappointed with the horchata since I asked the waitress if there were pieces of rice in it and she told me there was, but there actually wasn't. That wasn't really her fault as her English wasn't very good, and I'm pretty sure she didn't understand my question, but I was still very disappointed. This place is worth trying if your in the area and looking for good authentic Mexican food, just don't expect anything fantastic.

24.description: I have to show some love to my 'hood!  Although not all things (or persons for that matter) from the East Side deserve some love, El Charro certainly deserves a big 'ol hug and plenty of kisses!This place is a diamond in the neighborhood!  The Mexican food is always fresh and made to order.  I typically go for their Tortas, Tacos, or Gorditas (asada/steak, pollo/chicken, or milanesa de pollo/breaded chicken).  Their aguas frescas are so BOMB-tastic!  Yes, I said "bombtastic!"It's worth noting that their Agua de Horchata is the most prized possession of El Charro!  Seriously, I've had friends go there solely for a large (more like GIGANTIC) Agua de Horchata!  It's seriously that GOOD.  I may have committed this crime as well.  :/  Who gets just a beverage and no food?  Well, this Agua de Horchata is not your typical beverage!Prices are very reasonable and the service is nice!Side note: Sometimes if you go during weekday evenings, you'll see some pretty attractive police officers eating there too!  Haha, YES, I just went there.  ENJOY!Final Tally:  3 Stars for the FOOD and 1 star for the hottie officers!

6.description: Adequate Mexican food in an area of the city where adequate is often the best you can get. I had a burrito and a steak taco, and despite asking for them to go easy on the refried beans on the burrito, it was more beans than meat. The salsa is so-so, and the place is a small store front place you can easily drive by.

22.description: I had the chicken enchiladas verde to go which were good, the pico de gallo was nice and spicy, and the horchata is better than any other place. The previous compliments to the horchata are not exaggerated, mattered a little  something extra in there that makes it a little more rich, maybe vanilla? It's definitely worth trying.

15.description: One of the best places in this area. I like their gorditas de biztec or de pastor. They have great agua de horchata

7.description: I'm disappointed in this place! they used to serve good quality food, now it's just all about money to them. I use to order the steak nachos supreme back in the days and they used to give you a lot of chihuahua cheese melted over nice juicy steak! Now it's just tortillas loaded with beans and a little bit of steak and about a handful of cheese. I ordered a steak nacho supreme and I swear it was mostly all dried up tortilla chips with beans lettuce and tomatoes cilantro and onion I barely had any cheese or meat on it! For 10.95 it should be loaded!

8.description: "The food is good stop by if in the neighbor."

3.description: I tried this restaurant for the first time this weekend.  With a taste for tacos on my mind I entered and immediately noticed how nice and clean the dinning area was.  The ambiance is bright with lots of natural light coming in through the clean windows.  The cooking area is in the rear and compact but efficient.  I was asked if a menu was needed - there are no carry out menus in sight - and was advised that the taco dinner was available to me although it was not on the menu.  The service was friendly and efficient, the clientele calm and quiet - at least at that hour - and the food was both delicious and reasonably priced.  I am always on the lookout for good restaurants on Chicago's south side and this was a good find.  I'll head back and try some of the other menu selections soon.

14.description: Run of the mill, but very quick. Steak tacos were alright, server was polite and quick. But he couldnt tell if I was mexican or what. I also kept switching between Spanish and English. So, I dont blame him. Salsa is crazy hot. Watch where your hands go after...

1.description: Food is terrible... I had to throw away my $20 meal and ordered a pizza instead. Never going back.

0.description: I love the rice here , the only place I'll get the chicken rice . Also the egg rolls are big and delicious :)

Time has truly forgotten about this place.You drive by an old brick building on the corner of a not-so-nice neighborhood. The only indication that it's even a bar is that it has a small Bud Light neon. If you look closely, you might notice the antique Schlitz stained glass. Park the car next to the crumbling sidewalk with a 7 food pothole - it's time for a drink.Try and walk in - but the two front doors are locked. Just go around to the side door next to the half-torn down houses, garbage cans full of old clothes, and old marina on the Calumet River. Good, you finally found your way in - welcome to the 1950's. Your cell phone is temporarily out of service.It's poorly lit - maybe three lights in the whole place. Nothing's changed in here for decades. Beautiful antique ceiling, wooden back bar, and beer taps. If you look above the bar you'll notice a hanging bamboo structure where the bar gets it's name. Even a pool table if you are ready to throw down. Feeling lazy? Got a TV if you want to catch the game. They don't have Schlitz, but Old Style cans are only $2.50.There's several arcade machines tucked away in the corner which are unplugged to save money. Doubt they will ever be plugged in again. The heat is barely on, with the place hovering around a cool fifty-five degrees. If you're a VIP - they will give you a personal space heater on a stool. Their TV is so fuzzy that it makes standard definition look like a luxury. Most people stopped coming here when the bridge was closed in early 2011, and the people in the bar don't even like the neighborhood that they live in - one mile from Indiana. The floors and bar haven't been cleaned in years, but you can't tell because it's so dark. Credit cards aren't even a figment of anyone's imagination in this place. The outdated "personal hygiene" vending machine is the men's restroom toilet paper holder, and the faucet puts out a heavy drip every two seconds.This bar is one of the most depressing I've ever been to, however, at the same time it had an air of mystery and authenticity about it that you'd never get elsewhere.

3.description: Have you ever seen the Talking Heads video for Road to Nowhere? Driving down that barren expanse of road you will happen upon Phils Kastle. It's an old-fashioned, kitschy diner. It seems a little misplaced here, I would expect to encounter this place somewhere in the South, maybe as part of a road trip to New Orleans.So you desire a scone? How about a fritatta? HA! This is the east side. How about some real food. Wide menu. Great place for breakfast. They take pride in their gyros. Service has always been pleasant.

1.description: From the outside it doesn't look to inviting,  but don't be fooled. Yes by all standards it's outdated. The pros, super clean inside,  very friendly, good value, and most important the food was pretty good. I walked in there and it was spotless,  that  reassured me  about ordering food.

2.description: Hello,FOOD SNOB here.From the outside its a DIVE  but when you enter its a blast from the past.  Old fashion Diner.  For years I pass by this place and heard how good their burgers are.   Looks like they changed ownership.  Is now just your average Burger.  Had the Baby Monster Burger.  Came in a huge bun and the patty was 1/4" thick but sorry to say not homemade as before.  I must say the Fries were Excellent.  And prices are very reasonable. They do have Breakfast.  Might try that next time if I'm in the area.

5.description: This place is great. I feel like I'm in a scene from The Deer Hunter every time I walk through the door. This is about as blue-collar working class steel-mill South Chicago as it gets. Yes, it's small, yes, it's out of the way, and it probably wouldn't hurt to wipe the place down with some heavy duty bleach once in a while, but that's what makes it so great. I live on the North Side, and I make the 45 minute journey down here JUST for this place. When friends from out of town come in, this is one of the places I try to take them.Mary is great, always greets you with a smile and a "hi baby, what can I get you?". It's great. I absolutely love coming here. It's about as unpretentious as you can get. The burgers are really good- get the monster burger with gyro meat added. It's fantastic!

6.description: I gotta tell ya, I'm a White Castle fanatic. That's right. "Sliders" don't gross me out; I'm addicted to chicken rings with honey mustard; and I adore their artificial flavored strawberry shakes. But going to White Castle can get a little repetitive, so when I want to shake things up a bit, I head to Phil's Kastle.This place has been serving "homemade" sliders on the east side since the '30s. Phil, himself, told me that little tidbit of info. (Although, I'm not sure if it was actually the same Phil that's been flipping burgers all this time---perhaps his pops started it??) Anyway, the Kastle is an old Greek diner, close to the lake, right by the famous "Blues Brothers bridge". But Phil's Kastle is NOT your typical Greek diner. You won't find any frozen GFS or Costco prepackaged foods here. Phil makes everything made-to-order from scractch, from his tasty breakfast sandwiches right down to his delicious burgers.I'm a fan of the double cheeseburger. It's like eating a "crave case" of sliders all squished into one bun. Two heaping beef patties are pan-fried in butter (i think! at least it tastes like butter!) and then smothered in grilled onions, cheese, and some kind of secret seasoning that makes the burger taste exacly like a White Castle. Top it off with a little mustard, ketchup, mayo, and some of Phil's crunchy hand-cut fries, and you might never return to White Castle again--especially when you can get a double monster burger, fries, and a pop for $3.99!For those looking for the true slider experience, try one of Phil's "baby" burgers. These little puppies are what makes him famous on the southside. Pint-sized versions of his larger burgers, these little greasy messes are oh-so-tasty!Go ahead and give Phil's a try. Phil's a nice guy and he makes one hell of a burger.

7.description: The food is just average, just like the service. Avoid it if possible. The prices are reasonable, but thats about it.

0.description: The place is a total dive on the outside.  And when you walk in, it's a total dive on the inside too.  Very consistent.  It's a medium to smallish diner sporting a lunch counter with stools and also a bunch of booths off to the side.  Everything is a little damaged because it's at least 50 years old.   It's like if you took a time machine from opening day to present day you'd be like..."hmm, you got a new cash register".  And that would be it.  I stopped in at about 3pm for lunch and ordered the double burger.  No one else was in.    The lady making it was very nice and was quite accommodating with my requests for extra ketchup and hot peppers and what not.  After that I had a grilled cheese sandwich for dessert.  On my way out she offered to refill my water bottle.  Nice.This would be a great place to have across the street from me.  I'd saunter in every now and then and have a grilled cheese sando, burger or whatever.  Then I'd be like, "thanks alot..see you next time".  And then I'd go home.   Wonderful. As it is, this dump is in the middle of nowhere right across the bridge from that Calumet Fisheries place on 95th Street.  I can't see how they can do much business.  Maybe 50 years ago the traffic around this area was different.  I don't know. But present day, it'd take an act of of Bourdain to boost business.  Which I think they would appreciate.

4.description: Phil's is like stepping back into the past, when Alan Ladd was making his movie in South Chicago in the 40's.  You will see everyone in there from yachtsman and Bank VP's to the blue collar workers and kids in the hood lookin' for a cheap burger. They have the baby Monster Burger for $1.49 with fries.  Great breakfast food, real Gyro's and the special is 3 for $10.00.  You have to try it, but just pretend you are on vacation in a small town, when in reality, you are in Chicago.  Near Calumet Park, 95th Blues Brothers Bridge and not far from the Skyway.  Enjoy...
